Fantasy 











 





Texas justice
 




Tim Duncan is all over the floor as the Spurs take a 2-1 lead.  (AP)



    

    

      The Suns and Spurs are trading blows -- and not in the hypothetical 
      sense. San Antonio has bruiser Tim Duncan, who abuses 
      Phoenix for 33 and 19 in a 108-101 win; Tony Mejia says 
      it shows you don't mess with the best.
    

  
 Related Links:• Spurs 2-1 | CLE-NJ: Kidd lifts Nets | Freeman's take | Blog | Series page• Series: UT-GS | DET-CHI | Mejia: Fri. Truths | Mailbag |  Baron talks


 


 

 





 Dad will be out of sight, out of mind on Mom's Day


    

      
      With a family of his own and a TPC lead at Sawgrass, Sean O'Hair can 
      ponder his blessings instead of years 
      spent with an overbearing father, Steve Elling says.
    

  
• O'Hair one up on Lefty | Leaderboard | Tee times


 

 





 Castroneves takes Indy 500 pole in new strategy game


    

      
      Two-time winner Helio 
      Castroneves gets bragging rights after surviving a late 
      charge by Tony Kanaan to win the pole for the Indy 500, where 11 drivers 
      lock down spots.
